abstract: Yahoo and Carl Icahn said Monday that they had reached a settlement that would keep most of Yahoo’s directors in place but add Mr. Icahn and two of his allies to the Web company’s board. The deal ends a fierce proxy feud, in which Mr. Icahn had been trying to install his own slate of directors and push Yahoo toward a deal with Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo and Carl Icahn said Monday that they had reached a settlement that would keep most of Yahoo’s directors in place but add Mr. Icahn and two of his allies to the Web company’s board. The deal ends a fierce proxy feud, in which Mr. Icahn had been trying to install his own slate of directors and push Yahoo toward a deal with Microsoft.

headline.main: Yahoo and Icahn Settle Proxy Fight

abstract: With key shareholders choosing not to support his plan to unseat Yahoo’s board, Carl C. Icahn has backed down and agreed to accept three board seats as a compromise. Yahoo will most likely try to stabilize its operations, get its ad deal with Google approved, rethink Jerry Yang as chief executive and wait for Microsoft to decide whether to make a renewed offer to buy the company.
snippet: With key shareholders choosing not to support his plan to unseat Yahoo’s board, Carl C. Icahn has backed down and agreed to accept three board seats as a compromise. Yahoo will most likely try to stabilize its operations, get its ad deal with Goog...
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn backed down over the weekend and worked out an agreement with Yahoo to join Yahoo’s board, along with two more people on his slate, which had been set to go to shareholders for a vote on Friday. Yahoo’s statement is here.

headline.main: A Truce for Yahoo, but the War May Not Be Over
Yahoo’s Stock Falls as Deal Hopes Dim

abstract: “Community” was the buzzword at last week’s E3 gaming conference in Los Angeles. The three major makers of gaming consoles — Microsoft, Sony and Nintendo — all announced new features aimed at more tightly connecting their users to each other.
snippet: “Community” was the buzzword at last week’s E3 gaming conference in Los Angeles. The three major makers of gaming consoles — Microsoft, Sony and Nintendo — all announced new features aimed at more tightly connecting their users to each other.
lead_paragraph: As a technology product matures, it’s common that the companies pushing it rally around a theme that they believe will move its acceptance to the next level. And at last week’s E3 video game conference in Los Angeles, the word was “community,” the ability to connect to and interact with other players around the world.

headline.main: It’s Not a Game Console, It’s a Community

abstract: Analysts and investors on Monday tried to gauge what Yahoo‘s truce with Carl Icahn meant for the fate of the Web company. Some said the odds of a sale to Microsoft had decreased, but others argued that the settlement may have merely delayed a Yahoo sale.
lead_paragraph: Analysts and investors on Monday tried to gauge what Yahoo‘s truce with Carl Icahn meant for the fate of the Web company. Some said the odds of a sale to Microsoft had decreased, but others argued that the settlement may have merely delayed a Yahoo sale.
